Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
 How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
 Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.

ALLEGATION:
Lahser Respite Home staff did not provide an explanation or report the bruises on
Youth A’s face, back and hands after his 02/17/22 to 02/21/22 stay at Lahser
Respite Home.
INVESTIGATION:
Youth A’s mother
I interviewed Youth A’s mother by telephone on 03/07/2022. Youth A’s mother stated
Youth A was at Lahser Respite Home 02/10/22 to 02/14/22. She stated Youth A was
not in respite care 02/17/22 to 02/21/22. Youth A’s mother stated she received a text
message from Youth A’s teacher on 02/14/22 stating Youth A has an injury on his
forehead. Youth A’s mother stated she was out of the country and had Youth A’s
father take pictures of Youth A’s injuries when he returned from school. Youth A’s
mother stated Youth A’s injuries have cleared up without issue.
Youth A
Youth A is nonverbal and was not interviewed for this investigation. Youth A’s
paperwork from his 02/10/22 to 02/14/22 respite care was reviewed at Lahser
Respite Home.
 Youth A’s cursory physical dated 02/10/22 states Youth A has an abrasion on
the middle of his nose and callouses on both of his hands and feet. This
physical was completed by Staff person 2.
 Youth A’s cursory physical dated 02/14/22 states Youth A is the same as the
admission cursory physical, but includes the words “light scuff on forehead.”
Body chart shows a horizontal line in the middle of the forehead. This physical
was completed by Staff person 1.
 Youth A’s daily progress notes 02/10/22 to 02/14/22 were reviewed. There is
not documentation about Youth A’s mark on his forehead. 02/14/22 progress
notes states Youth A was discharged without concerns.
 Youth A’s discharge summary report for 02/10/22 to 02/14/22 states Youth A
did not have issues with eating or sleeping and had a positive stay. It states
Youth A was discharged to Teacher on 02/14/22.
Staff person 1
I interviewed Staff person 1 by telephone on 03/10/22. Staff person 1 stated Youth A
had an abrasion in the middle of his forehead on 02/14/22. Staff person 1 stated she
does not know how or when Youth A obtained the mark, but she noticed it on
02/14/22. Staff person 1 stated she did not notice any other marks on Youth A on
02/14/22 that were not previously documented.
Staff person 2
I interviewed Staff person 2 at Lahser Respite Home on 03/11/22 with another
Department of Health and Human Service worker. Staff person 2 stated she saw a
circular mark in the middle of Youth A’s forehead on 02/13/22. Staff person 2
described the mark as a scuff with the skin unbroken and does not recall if the mark
was on Youth A’s forehead on 02/12/22. Staff person 2 stated Youth A has
3

calloused hands and feet from sitting on his hands and feet in a kneeling position
and rocking back and forth. Staff person 2 stated she is unaware of any mark on
Youth A’s cheek or back. Staff person 2 stated she saw a picture of Youth A’s
forehead and the mark on his forehead was worse than when she dropped Youth A
off at school on 02/14/22.
Staff person 3
I interviewed Staff person 3 by telephone on 03/15/22. Staff person 3 stated she
noticed Youth A’s forehead abrasion on 02/12/22. Staff person 3 stated she did not
know how or when Youth A obtained the abrasion. Staff person 3 stated the skin
was broken with spots of blood on the penny sized abrasion in the middle of Youth
A’s forehead and did not notice an abrasion on his cheek. Staff person 3 stated she
assumed the incident occurred on the previous shift and did not follow up. Staff
person 3 stated she did not recall having a verbal update about the youths on
02/12/22 with Staff person 2 at the beginning of her shift.
Teacher
I interviewed Teacher by telephone on 03/07/22. Teacher stated Youth A did not
have an abrasion on his forehead on 02/10/22 and 02/11/22. Teacher stated she
noticed the abrasion on Youth A’s forehead after the weekend on 02/14/22 and
contacted Youth A’s mother. Teacher stated she did not suspect abuse or neglect
because Youth A has a history of self injurious behavior. Teacher stated she
witnessed Youth A biting the base of his thumb in class. Teacher stated she is
unaware of any marks on Youth A’s back.

Pictures
Another Department of Health and Human Service forwarded pictures of Youth A’s
injuries taken by his father reportedly on 02/14/2022 after school.
 Picture 1 - Youth A has a round scab in the middle of his upper forehead and
an abrasion on his left cheek.
 Picture 2 - Youth A has an abrasion on the base of his right thumb.
 Picture 3 - Youth A has an abrasion below his right shoulder blade.
Local law enforcement was notified of this allegation, Lahser Respite Home staff did
not provide an explanation or report the bruises on Youth A’s face, back and hands
after his 02/17/22 to 02/21/22 stay at Lahser Respite Home.
Another Department of Health and Human Service agency conducted an
investigation without findings.
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.4126 Sufficiency of staff.
The licensee shall have a sufficient number of administrative,
supervisory, social service, direct care, and other staff on duty to
perform the prescribed functions required by these
administrative rules and in the agency’s program statement and
to provide for the continual needs, protection, and supervision of
residents.
5

ANALYSIS: Lahser Respite Home staff saw a mark on Youth A’s forehead
as early as 02/12/22, but there is not documentation of when
and how the marked occurred. Teacher stated witnessing Youth
A bite the base of his thumb in class on 02/14/22 and saw the
mark on Youth A’s forehead on 02/14/22. Youth A’s mark under
his right shoulder blade is unknown because Lahser Respite
Home staff and Teacher did not lift up Youth A’s shirt to inspect
for marks. It cannot be determined if the abrasion on Youth A’s
left cheek occurred at Lahser Respite Home, at school or at his
home. Based on the interviews it is found that Lahser Respite
Home did not provide for the needs, protection, and supervision
of Youth A by monitoring him and documenting how he obtained
the mark on his forehead.
TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE:
There is to be a shift change report either verbally or written to
facilitate the needs of the youth in care.
Injuries are to be documented in an incident report or in the
youth’s progress note on the date of the incident or the date the
injury is found.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
IV. RECOMMENDATION
The continuance of a regular license is recommended upon receipt of an approved
corrective action plan.
